headline: 2022 Ohio Primaries
sentences: On the Democratic side, watch the contest between former Bernie Sanders surrogate state Sen. Nina Turner (D) and U.S. Rep. Shontel M.Brown (D) in the 11th District, formerly represented by Marcia Fudge (D).

Former Trump aide Max Miller is running for the GOP nomination in the newly redrawn 7th District, which covers an area previously represented by retiring Republican Reps. Anthony Gonzalez and Bob Gibbs.
The Post estimated the lean of 2022 congressional districts using 2020 presidential results by precinct from Decision Desk HQ and estimates where actual votes at the precinct level were unavailable.
Mike DeWine (R) is also trying to fend off a challenge from the right in former congressman Jim Renacci (R), who touts his similarities to Trump without having received his endorsement.
He has hit DeWine for trying to carve a middle path against covid by requiring masks and shutting down some public spaces and schools when the pandemic began.
But Rep. Marcy Kaptur (D) is facing a slew of Republicans competing to face her in the 9th District, which was redrawn unfavorably to her.
The state Supreme Court rejected the initial map drawn by Republican legislators, but a new map they submitted was not much different.
Districts classified as Strong Biden and Strong Trump show where a candidate is estimated to have won by 15 percentage points or more.
Former state treasurer Josh Mandel also fiercely claimed the Trump mantle and is getting help from TV ads from the Club for Growth.

WHAT TO WATCH
Ohio is the first significant test of former President Donald Trumps influence over the Republican Party this cycle.
Rob Portman (R) is retiring, leaving a messy GOP primary to replace him while Democrats have rallied behind Rep. Tim Ryan (D).
State Sen. Matt Dolan (R) is the only candidate who believes Trump should move on from losing the 2020 election.
